page.title: List of Justin Timberlake live performances

revision.text:
[[File:Justin Timberlake 2014 February 2.jpg|thumb|right|Justin Timberlake performing on his [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour|20/20 Experience World Tour]] in 2014]] American singer [[Justin Timberlake]] has embarked on five [[concert tours]] during his solo career, three of which have been worldwide and two of which have been collaborative.{{refn|group=nb|The tours and performances by Justin Timberlake within the group [[NSYNC]] are not included.}} His 2003 debut [[The Justified World Tour]] began at intimate gigs at clubs and theatres in the United States and Australia before expanding to arenas in Europe.{{cite press release |title=McDonald's Teams With Justin Timberlake on European Concert Tour |url=http://www.prnewswire.co.uk/cgi/news/release?id=111425 |publisher=PRNewswire |date=2003-11-07 |accessdate=2008-12-23}} In summer 2003, Timberlake and [[Christina Aguilera]] headlined the [[Justified/Stripped Tour]].{{cite web|accessdate=April 22, 2008|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1472259/20030603/timberlake_justin.jhtml|title=Justified And Stripped Preview: Timberlake Talks Tour|publisher=MTV}} Later that year he recorded a song "[[I'm Lovin' It (song)|I'm Lovin' It]]", used by [[McDonald's]] as the theme to its "I'm Lovin' It" campaign. The deal with McDonald's earned Timberlake an estimated $6 million. A tour titled Justified and Lovin' It Live was included with the deal, following his initial Justified World Tour.{{cite web |date=September 3, 2003 |accessdate=December 17, 2014|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/69289/timberlake-ties-up-tasty-mcdonalds-deal |title=Timberlake Ties Up Tasty McDonald's Deal |work=Billboard}} For the release of his sophomore record ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'', Timberlake embarked on his second worldwide tour [[FutureSex/LoveShow]] in 2007, which eventually became the third highest-grossing concert tour of the year. During the tour, he visited Asia, Europe, North America and Oceania. In 2013, Timberlake took part in his second collaborative tour, [[Legends of the Summer]], in which he was co-headlining with rapper, frequent collaborator [[Jay Z]]. The all-[[stadium]] tour that took place in North America{{cite web | url=https://pitchfork.com/news/49659-jay-z-and-justin-timberlake-detail-their-summer-stadium-tour-legends-of-the-summer/ | title=Jay-Z and Justin Timberlake Detail Their Summer Stadium Tour, "Legends of the Summer" | work=Pitchfork Media | date=February 22, 2013 | accessdate=February 28, 2016}} was praised by music critics, who highlighted the great chemistry between both artists.{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/jay-z-and-justin-timberlake-take-over-yankee-stadium-as-legends-of-the-summer-20130720 | title=Jay Z and Justin Timberlake Take Over Yankee Stadium as Legends of the Summer | work=Rolling Stone | date=July 20, 2013 | accessdate=February 29, 2016 | author=Jeff Rosenthal}} It was followed by [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour]], which became the second highest-grossing tour of 2014 and one of the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours#2010s|highest-grossing tours of the decade]]. This made Timberlake the highest-grossing solo touring artist of the year. The [[Man of the Woods Tour]] is his sixth and current headlining concert tour. Timberlake's televised performances include his debut at the [[2002 MTV Video Music Awards]], the controversial [[Super Bowl XXXVIII]] [[Super Bowl XXXVIII halftime show controversy|halftime show]] as a guest act, his comeback performance at the [[55th Annual Grammy Awards]], his medley number at the [[2013 MTV Video Music Awards]], several appearances on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' and the [[Super Bowl LII halftime show]]. ==Concert tours== {|class="wikitable" ! style="background:silver;"| Year !! style="background:silver;"| Title !! style="background:silver;"| Duration !! style="background:silver;"| Number of
performances !! style="background:silver;"| Gross |- style="background:#dcdcdc;" |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=15 | 2003–04 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[The Justified World Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| May 7, 2003 – June 19, 2004 (Worldwide)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
61
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
-
|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | The Justified World Tour (also known as Lovin' It Live and Justified World Tour and Lovin' It Live){{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/mcdonaldsr-and-justin-timberlake-team-up-for-us-and-european-concert-tour-72458062.html|title=McDonald's(R) and Justin Timberlake Team Up for U.S. and European Concert...|author=McDonald's Corporation|date=10 October 2003|work=prnewswire.com}} was Justin Timberlake's debut concert tour. The tour showcased material his debut studio album, ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' (2002). The video album ''[[Justin Timberlake: Live from London]]'' was released on December 15, 2003, by [[Jive Records]]. It documents Timberlake's performance at the [[London Arena]] on May 18, 2003.{{cite web|url=https://www.allmovie.com/movie/justin-timberlake-live-from-london-v295322|title=Justin Timberlake: Live from London (2003) - Trailers, Reviews, Synopsis, Showtimes and Cast - AllMovie|work=AllMovie}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2003 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[Justified and Stripped Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| June 4, 2003 – September 2, 2003 (North America)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
45
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
$30.2 million{{cite journal|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=bA8EAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA66&dq=billboard+boxscore+justin+timberlake+christina+aguilera+july+26,+2003&hl=vi&sa=X&ei=_MgNUpfTAaWTiQeXg4DoDw&ved=0CFAQ6AEwBg#v=onepage&q=billboard%20boxscore%20justin%20timberlake%20christina%20aguilera%20july%2026%2C%202003&f=false|title=Top 25 Tours|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|volume=115|issue=52|page=23|date=December 27, 2003|accessdate=August 16, 2013}}
|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | Justin Timberlake's first co-headlining venture, the Justified and Stripped Tour, featured American singer [[Christina Aguilera]]. The [[setlist]] was composed generally from Timberlake's ''Justified'' and Aguilera's ''Stripped''. However, both artists also added material from their early works, including Timberlake's work with [[NSYNC]] and [[Christina Aguilera (album)|Aguilera's self-titled debut album]]. The Justified and Stripped Tour was divided into five segments, two for Aguilera and three for Timberlake, with each segment being followed by an interlude to the next segment, and it ended with an encore, lasting for a total of 160 minutes. An [[extended play]], entitled ''Justin & Christina'', was released exclusively at [[Target Corporation|Target Stores]] to support the tour. The tour was met with mixed reviews from most contemporary [[music journalism|music critics]]. Some praised the maturities of the two artists, while others criticized their vocal abilities during the tour. They also believed Timberlake's part worked his considerable sex appeal. The tour was a commercial success, becoming the sixteenth highest-grossing tour in 2003. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2007 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[FutureSex/LoveShow]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| January 8, 2007 – December 6, 2007 (Worldwide)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
97
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
$126.8 million{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1047044/the-police-score-top-grossing-tour-of-07|title=Police, Timberlake Among Billboard Touring AwardFinalists|date=December 13, 2007|accessdate=December 14, 2008|last=Waddell|first=Ray|work=Billboard|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.}}
|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | Serving as Timberlake's second worldwide solo tour, FutureSex/LoveShow supported her second studio album, ''[[FutureSex/LoveShow]]'' (2006). It was the third highest-grossing concert tour of 2007 and drew more than 1.6 million people.{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1047044/the-police-score-top-grossing-tour-of-07|title=The Police Score Top-Grossing Tour Of '07|date=December 13, 2007|accessdate=December 14, 2008|last=Waddell|first=Ray|work=Billboard|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.}} Critics from ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' and ''[[The New York Times]]'' agreed that the show was "strictly grown and sexy" and Timberlake "has learned how to project sex-symbol edge."{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/justin-timberlake-brings-futuresex-to-madison-square-garden-live-report-20070817 | title=Justin Timberlake Brings 'FutureSex' to Madison Square Garden: Live Report | work=Rolling Stone | date=August 17, 2007 | accessdate=February 28, 2016 | author=Checkoway, Laura}} It featured several opening acts, including [[Pink (singer)|P!nk]], [[Good Charlotte]] and [[Fergie (singer)|Fergie]]. On November 19, 2007, a live video album named ''[[FutureSex/LoveShow: Live from Madison Square Garden]]'' was released.{{cite web | url=https://www.amazon.com/Futuresex-Loveshow-Madison-Square-Garden/dp/B0014BEDBG | title=Futuresex / Loveshow - Live from Madison Square Garden | publisher=Amazon (US) | accessdate=February 28, 2016}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2013 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[Legends of the Summer]] || style="background-color:#DCDCDC;" align="center"| July 17, 2013 – August 16, 2013 (North America) ||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
14
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
$75.3 million{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/5748070/roger-waters-passes-madonna-for-solo-boxscore-record-with-459m-wall-live|title=Roger Waters Passes Madonna for Solo Boxscore Record with $459M Wall Live Tour|first=Bob|last=Allen|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=October 4, 2013|accessdate=October 11, 2013}}
|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | The Legends of the Summer Stadium Tour was a co-headlining concert tour by [[Justin Timberlake]] and American rapper [[Jay Z]]. The tour supported Timberlake's third studio album, ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'' (2013) and Jay Z's twelfth studio album, ''[[Magna Carta Holy Grail]]'' (2013). For a "special preview" of the tour both artists performed at the [[Olympic Park, London|Olympic Park]] in [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] as part of the [[Wireless Festival]].{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/justin-timberlake/69369 |title=Justin Timberlake planning solo tour after Jay-Z jaunt |work=NME |date=March 24, 2013 |accessdate=May 5, 2013}} They performed in major stadiums across the U.S. and Canada. It was praised by critics, with ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'''s Karen Bliss writing "there was no one-upmanship, just camaraderie, not competition, two guys that work well together."{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/2544136/jay-z-justin-timberlake-in-playful-mood-as-legends-of-the-summer | title=Jay Z & Justin Timberlake In Playful Mood As 'Legends of the Summer' Tour Kicks Off in Toronto | work=Billboard | date=July 18, 2013 | accessdate=February 29, 2016 | author=Bliss, Karen}} With the 14 dates sold-out, it was the 15th highest-grossing tour of 2013.{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/list/5820092/top-25-tours-of-2013 | title=Top 25 Tours of 2013 | work=Billboard | date=December 13, 2015 | accessdate=March 2, 2016}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2013–15 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| November 6, 2013 – January 2, 2015 (Worldwide)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
134
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
$231.6 million{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/news/touring/6443514/justin-timberlakes-2020-tour-earned-232-million-in-ticket-sales|title=Justin Timberlake's 20/20 Tour Earned $232 Million in Ticket Sales|date=October 4, 2013|accessdate=June 9, 2014|last= Bob| first= Allen|work=Billboard}}Billboard boxscore: *{{cite web|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6LQjCdTCf?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=November 27, 2013 |url=https://billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |title=Billboard Biz: Current Boxscore |date=November 27, 2013 |accessdate=November 27, 2013 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Mkahena0?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=January 19, 2014 |url=https://billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |title=Billboard Biz: Current Boxscore |date=January 15, 2014 |accessdate=January 19, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6N11n6cKr?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=January 30, 2014 |url=https://billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |title=Billboard Biz: Current Boxscore |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=January 30, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6OCIRz5u2?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=March 19, 2014 |url=https://billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |title=Billboard Biz: Current Boxscore |date=March 19, 2014 |accessdate=March 19, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|url=http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/currentboxscore.jsp |title=Billboard Boxscore :: Current Scores |date=June 18, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6QQlU7EKg?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=June 18, 2014 |accessdate=June 18, 2014 |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|url=http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/currentboxscore.jsp |title=Billboard Boxscore :: Current Scores |date=October 8, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6TB477YD6?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=October 8, 2014 |accessdate=October 8, 2014 |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|url=http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/currentboxscore.jsp |title=Billboard Boxscore :: Current Scores |date=October 29, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6TiTChUzr?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=October 30, 2014 |accessdate=October 30, 2014 |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|url=http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/currentboxscore.jsp |title=Billboard Boxscore :: Current Scores |date=December 17, 2014 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6UzwDeTW1?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=December 22, 2014 |accessdate=December 21, 2014 |url-status=dead |df= }} *{{cite web|url=http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/charts/currentboxscore.jsp |title=Billboard Boxscore :: Current Scores |date=January 14, 2015 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6VaF6mqAS?url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/current-boxscore |archivedate=January 14, 2015 |accessdate=January 14, 2015 |url-status=dead |df= }}
|- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | The 20/20 Experience World Tour was launched in support of his third and fourth studio albums, ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'' (2013) and ''[[The 20/20 Experience – 2 of 2]]'' (2013).{{cite web|title=Justin Timberlake Announces '20/20' World Tour|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1560696/justin-timberlake-announces-2020-world-tour|date=May 6, 2013 |accessdate=December 23, 2014 |author=Billboard Staff|work=Billboard}} The 20/20 Experience allowed Timberlake to throw back to the [[Big band|big-band]] era,{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6458102/happy-birthday-justin-timberlake-great-performances|title=Happy Birthday, Justin Timberlake: 5 Great Performances|first=Erin|last=Strecker|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=January 31, 2015|accessdate=May 24, 2015}} its stage production embraced a vintage sheen and everyone in classic suits. Timberlake had a [[horn section]] onstage with him called The Regiment Horns, among the big-band orchestra the Tennessee Kids.{{cite web|url=http://music.cbc.ca/#!/blogs/2013/4/The-Jazz-Evangelist-Justin-Timberlake-brings-back-the-horn-section |title=The Jazz Evangelist: Justin Timberlake brings back the horn section |publisher=CBC music |date=April 15, 2013 |accessdate=March 2, 2016 |author=Tamashiro, Tim |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160301002442/http://music.cbc.ca/ |archivedate=March 1, 2016 |df= }} During the tour, Timberlake visited Africa, Asia, Europe, North America and Oceania. The tour received acclaim from critics,{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/concert-review-justin-timberlake-at-672976|title=Justin Timberlake Touts Suits, Ties and Tequila at Newly Renovated Forum: Concert Review|first=Emily|last=Zemler|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=January 21, 2014|accessdate=March 24, 2015}} became the second highest-grossing tour of 2014{{cite web|title=Live Music's $20 Billion Year: Rolling Stones, One Direction, Live Nation Top Boxscore's Year-End |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/6406028/boxscore-top-tours-2014-rolling-stones-live-nation|work=Billboard|date=December 12, 2014 |accessdate=December 12, 2014 |last= Waddell | first=Ray}} and one of the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours#2010s|highest-grossing tours of the decade]]. This made Timberlake the highest-grossing solo touring artist of the year. Canadian singer [[The Weeknd]] featured as the opening act in selected North America dates.{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-juice/5778176/the-weeknd-to-open-for-justin-timberlake-on-2020-experience-tour | title=The Weeknd To Open For Justin Timberlake On '20/20 Experience' Tour | publisher=Prometheus Global Media | work=Billboard | date=4 November 2013 | accessdate=27 November 2015 | author=Payne, Chris}} Showcasing the final date of the tour at Las Vegas’ [[MGM Grand Garden Arena]], the space-age themed concert film—titled ''JT + The Tennessee Kids'' and directed by [[Jonathan Demme]]—will premiere at the [[2016 Toronto International Film Festival]].{{cite web | url=https://www.indiewire.com/2016/07/tiff-film-list-analysis-toronto-international-film-festival-1201710079/ | title=TIFF Lineup: 5 Reasons to Get Excited About the 2016 Program | work=[[Indie Wire]] | date=July 26, 2016 | accessdate=July 27, 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://uproxx.com/movies/toronto-international-film-festival-2016-schedule/ | title=The 2016 Toronto Film Festival Schedule Has Justin Timberlake, Oscar Contenders, And A Lot Of Amy Adams| work=[[Uproxx]] | date=July 26, 2016 | accessdate=July 27, 2016}} The concert film was released on streaming service [[Netflix]] in October 2016.{{cite web | url=https://www.ew.com/article/2016/09/09/justin-timberlake-2020-concert-movie-netflix | title=Justin Timberlake 20/20 concert movie dropping on Netflix | work=Entertainment Weekly | date=September 9, 2016 | accessdate=September 9, 2016 | author=Romano, Nick}} |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" width=5 | 2018–19 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| [[The Man of the Woods Tour]] || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center"| March 13, 2018 – April 13, 2019 (Worldwide)||style="background-color: #DCDCDC;"|
115
|| style="background:#dcdcdc;"|
$226.3 million{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8507576/justin-timberlake-earns-226-million-man-of-the-woods-tour/|title=Justin Timberlake Man of the Woods Tour|last=Eric|first=Frankenberg |date=April 17, 2019 |work=Billboard |accessdate=April 17, 2019}}
|- |- | colspan="5" style="border-bottom-width:3px; padding:5px;" | Timberlake embarked on The Man of the Woods Tour in support of his fifth studio album, ''[[Man of the Woods]]'' (2018).{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/after-super-bowl-set-justin-timberlake-extends-man-of-the-woods-tour-into-2019-1202687265/|title=After Super Bowl Set, Justin Timberlake Extends 'Man of the Woods' Tour Into 2019|author=Variety Staff |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |publisher=Variety Media, LLC|date=February 5, 2018}} ''The Man of the Woods Tour'' received positive reviews from critics and was the sixth highest-grossing tour of 2018.{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8493832/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-tour-sales|title=Justin Timberlake Crosses $150 Million Mark With Man of the Woods Tour|last=Eric|first=Frankenberg |date=January 16, 2018 |work=Billboard |accessdate=January 16, 2019}} ''Billboard'' critics ranked ''The Man of the Woods Tour'' as one of the best live shows of 2018.{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/concerts/8488754/best-concerts-2018-live-shows|title=The Best Live Shows Of 2018|website=Billboard}} David Menconi of ''[[The News & Observer]]'' said "Justin Timberlake returns to the stage and proves why he's America's pop star", and noted him as "The Prince of Pop". He also said of the show that Timberlake "Sang quite well... But he danced even better, and that's what turned the crowd on most of all. How he moved was at least as important as how he sang."{{cite web|url=https://www.newsobserver.com/entertainment/article223921280.html|title=Review: Justin Timberlake returns to the stage and proves why he’s America’s pop star|website=newsobserver}} Chris Conde of ''[[San Antonio Current]]'' deemed it "an spectacle of undeniable talent... Even if you don’t like pop music, Timberlake's show was so rich in musicianship and showmanship that anyone wanting to say something bad would be hard-pressed to, ahem, justify a negative review."{{cite web|url=https://www.sacurrent.com/sa-sound/archives/2019/01/20/bonfire-crackles-and-pop-justin-timberlake-literally-lights-the-atandt-center-on-fire|title=Bonfire Crackles and Pop: Justin Timberlake Lit the AT&T Center on Fire|first=Chris|last=Conde|website=San Antonio Current}} |} ==Concerts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !align="left" valign="top" width="120"| Date !align="left" valign="top" width="250"| Event !align="left" valign="top" width="650"| Notes |- | February 2, 2013 !scope="row"| [[DirecTV]] Super Saturday Night | After four years not performing in concert, Timberlake appeared the night before the [[Super Bowl XLVII|2013 Super Bowl]] and performed during the "DirecTV Super Saturday Night" in [[New Orleans]]. Backed by a full band and four backup singers called the Tennessee Kids, the hour-and-a-half setlist featured two songs from his upcoming album ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'' ("[[Pusher Love Girl]]" and "That Girl"). [[Jay Z]] and [[Timbaland]] were featured guests.{{cite news | url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1701273/justin-timberlake-super-bowl-new-orleans-show/ | title=Justin Timberlake Makes Super Return At Pre-Super Bowl Gig | work=MTV news | date=February 3, 2013 | accessdate=September 15, 2015 | first=Craig | last=Lauren}} |} ==Guest act== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- !align="left" valign="top" width="120"| Date !align="left" valign="top" width="220"| Title !align="left" valign="top" width="680"| Notes |- | March 30, 2008 !scope="row"| [[Hard Candy Promo Tour|Hard Candy Promo Show]] | Timberlake and [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] performed their collaboration "[[4 Minutes]]" at Roseland Ballroom in [[New York City]].{{cite web|last=Harris|first=Chris|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1586631/20080501/madonna.jhtml|title=MTV review of the Roseland Ballroom Promo Concert|publisher=Mtv.com|date=May 1, 2008|accessdate=May 11, 2010}} |- | October 17, 2008 ! scope="row"| [[It Won't Be Soon Before Long Tour]] | Timberlake and [[Maroon 5]] performed "[[This Love (Maroon 5 song)|This Love]]" on the Las Vegas stop of their concert tour. |- | November 6, 2008 !scope="row"|[[Sticky & Sweet Tour]] | Timberlake performed "[[4 Minutes]]" with [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] on the Los Angeles stop of her concert tour.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.tvguide.com/News/Britney-Spears-Justin-35432.aspx|title= Britney and Justin Back Up Madonna – Separately|magazine=TV Guide|date=November 7, 2008|accessdate=November 7, 2008}} |- | August 26, 2015 !scope="row"|[[The 1989 World Tour]] | Timberlake and [[Taylor Swift]] performed "[[Mirrors (Justin Timberlake song)|Mirrors]]" at [[Staples Center]].{{cite web|last=Lindner|first=Emilee|title=Justin Timberlake And Selena Gomez Surprise Taylor Swift's 1989 Tour: Watch|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2252744/taylor-swift-justin-timberlake-selena-gomez-lisa-kudrow/|work=MTV News|date=August 27, 2015|accessdate=August 27, 2015}} The performance and rehearsals were featured on concert documentary ''The 1989 World Tour Live''.{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/6828843/taylor-swift-1989-world-tour-documentary-moments | title=Taylor Swift's 'The 1989 World Tour' Documentary: 10 Fascinating Moments | work=Billboard | date=January 1, 2016 | accessdate=March 2, 2016 | author=Lynch, Joe}} |} ==Televised performances== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:12%;"|Date ! style="width:20%;"|Event ! style="width:10%;"|City ! Performed song(s) !scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref.|Reference}} |- | August 29, 2002 !scope="row"| [[2002 MTV Video Music Awards]] | [[New York City]] | "[[Like I Love You]]" (with [[Clipse]]) | {{cite web | url=http://www.mtv.com/photos/mtv-video-music-awards-2002-highlights/1563803/2508591/photo/ | title=mtv video music awards: 2002 highlights | work=MTV | accessdate=February 28, 2016}} |- | December 9, 2002 !scope="row"| 2002 [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Award]]s | [[Las Vegas]] | "[[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]]" |{{cite
